River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful and well-choreographed and the dialogue is mostly in Japanese ( subtitles appear but after attempting their English translation it was hard for non-Japanese speakers to catch all the rapid conversations.
This film would make an excellent History of New Zealand course topic or unit.
